Articles.Content:
Bonjour tout le monde !

My name is Gatien ,and i'm from France.

I'm 18yo, i love astronomy and programming

I'm here to learn to to play KSP properly, because i suck.

My rocket are too powerful and 3 of them are orbiting the sun

Here is one of my rocket named "Sun Orbiter 2 ":

Flight In Progres :

Thank you for making this game !

Hi Gatien and welcome to the community

There are lots of people here who will give you a hand, but I think one of the great things about KSP is that you can experiment and find your own way to do things, good luck and have fun flying Gatien
In KSP there is no such thing as a "too powerful rocket" This being said, you might have trajectory issues. What are you trying to do with the rocket ?

I try to get the earth orbit.

I saw that there is a mod to get auto-trajectory. Should i install it ?

There is a mod called MechJeb, it is useful to learn from, but it can do too much for you I feel, you might want to try it then try flying by hand once you have seen a reasonable launch.

Oh and MechJeb is not a miracle worker, your rocket has to be able to make it to orbit

One thing you need to do to achieve Kerbin orbit is to tilt your rocket eventually... If you shoot straight up all the way you won't get orbit. I'm pretty sure there are tutorials out there on that, but what I generally do is shoot straight up, then tilt at 45 degrees or so when I'm at around 50 000 meters. I'm sure there's a lot better ways to do it though, I'm still experimenting. Et bienvenue sur les forums !
